title: Tayeb Salih
summary: Tayeb Salih (Arabic: الطيب صالح‎; 12 July 1929 – 18 February 2009)[1] was a Sudanese writer, cultural journalist for the BBC Arabic programme as well as for Arabic journals, and a staff member of UNESCO. He is best known for his novel Season of Migration to the North, considered to be one of the most important novels in Arabic literature.[2][3] His novels and short stories have been translated into English and more than a dozen other languages.[4]
